intro: Gossypium rhorii, commonly known as the African cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other cotton species and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by capsules containing fluffy seeds. Gossypium rhorii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
